clinical_study.brief_title: Preventing Non-communicable Diseases in Guatemala Through Sugary Drink Reduction
clinical_study.official_title: Preventing Non-communicable Diseases in Guatemala Through Sugary Drink Reduction

brief_summary.textblock: Sugar-sweetened beverages are a significant contributor to adult and childhood obesity in Guatemala. Policies to place health warning labels on sugar-sweetened beverages are being pursued, but there is little empirical data on how such labels influence people. The primary aim of this study is to test the association between sugar-sweetened beverage (SSB) warning posters compared to control posters and change in SSBs purchased compared to baseline by adolescents shopping at school cafeterias in Guatemala City, Guatemala. The hypothesis is that posters with information warning people of the health harms associated with overconsuming SSBs and promoting low sugar beverages will be associated with greater reductions in SSB purchases compared to a control poster.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Three private schools will be enrolled in the study (two larger, one smaller) that have students between the ages of 12 and 18. There will be no posters displayed at any of the schools during the baseline period. The two larger schools will be randomized to either an SSB warning/non-SSB promoting poster or a calorie/control poster that will be implemented in the school cafeterias during a four-week intervention period. To increase the sample size for the intervention condition, the intervention will also be implemented at a smaller school. For the primary analysis, data from both schools that displayed the intervention posters will be combined, clustering on school.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be told the researchers are interested in cafeteria purchase preferences, but participants will not know which condition has been assigned to individual participants.

primary_outcome.description: Total ounces of SSBs per transaction from sales data
Total number of calories for all beverages (SSBs and non-SSBs) per transaction from sales data

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of all transactions that include an SSB
other_outcome.description: Proportion of transactions with SSBs out of all food and beverage transactions

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of all beverage transactions that include an SSB
other_outcome.description: Proportion of transactions with SSBs out of beverage transactions only
Average of perceptions of two items (1=Extremely unhealthy; 7=Extremely healthy, lower values are more accurate)
Average of perceptions of two items (1=Extremely unhealthy; 7=Extremely healthy, higher values are more accurate)

other_outcome.measure: Perceived influence of poster among those who saw it
other_outcome.description: "Do you think the poster influenced what you purchased?" (1=Not at all; 5=Very much, higher values in the intervention condition indicate the intervention is perceived to be effective)
"How much do you trust the information on the poster?" (1=Not at all; 5=Very much, higher values in the intervention condition indicate the intervention is perceived to be trustworthy)

arm_group.description: This poster will display images of both SSBs and low or no sugar beverages with calories listed below the beverages. It will simply state that those beverages are sold in the school store.

arm_group.arm_group_label: SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster
arm_group.description: This poster will display images of both SSBs and low or no sugar beverages with calories listed below the beverages. In addition, the message will state that SSBs are high in sugar and should be avoided, while low or no sugar beverages are healthier options and should be chosen.

intervention.description: Red stop sign and avoidance message for sugar-sweetened beverages and green check mark and promotion message for non-sugar-sweetened beverage nutrition information
intervention.arm_group_label: SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster

intervention.description: Calories for sugar-sweetened and non-sugar-sweetened beverages

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Between 12 and 18 years old
- Made a food or beverage purchase
- Has permission from parent or caregiver to participate
- Has not yet completed the purchase assessment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 12 or over 18 years old
- Did not make a food or beverage purchase
- Parent or caregiver refused to give child permission to participate
- Already participated in the purchase assessment
